thread.title: Sunday Brunch guest David Gower licks fingers after handling raw chicken | Metro News
thread.title_full: Sunday Brunch guest David Gower licks fingers after handling raw chicken | Metro News

author: Olivia Waring For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Sunday Brunch guest David Gower licks fingers after handling raw chicken | Metro News
text:
Olivia Waring for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:47 am Seeing David Gower lick both his hands before cleaning them during a recipe with raw chicken made viewers – and us – feel very sick (Pictures: C4) 
Viewers of Sunday Brunch were left vomiting into their own brunches as they witnessed David Gower marinating raw chicken before licking his fingers. Sponsored 13 realities of going wedding dress shopping 
An outcry of utter disgust flooded Twitter as the former cricketer, who was cooking as a guest on the show, put both hands in his mouth directly after rubbing the raw chicken fillets in a bowl. 
It seems comedian and stand-in host Johnny Vegas was too late with the hygienic hand bath for 59-year-old David, and the sight made daytime telly viewers ‘spew’ at the thought of salmonella creeping into his system. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Yep. Obviously David’s batting skills are more important to him than his knowledge of basic hygiene. 
As David licked his second hand, he was spotted by show presenter Simon Rimmer from across the studio, but by that point it was much too late. The first finger goes in (Picture: C4) 
Coming over for the rather pointless hand bath, Johnny told David: ‘People out there just do not like you messing with raw chicken…. without washing your hands.’ Simon spots David as the second finger goes in (Picture: C4)
